content.description: This is an interesting route that deserves more action.  It has beta that goes at 5.11, though it's not immediately intuitive.  Mount the sandy ledge.  Use a strange knob in the roof, a pinch, a foot cam and a knee bar to make this sequence work.  Another krux awaits on the vertical wall above.
content.location: The bolt line right of Space Cowboy and left of Rock and Roll High School

content.description: Multiple distinct and interesting sections await you on this route.  Start by grabbing the dusty ledge and throwing your feet on some crap edges.  Work your way over the bulge and into the double gaston section.  Take a much needed rest before you enter the crimpy, balancey crux.  The way I do it involves some zig-zagging.  It's a fun route.
content.protection: Six bolts and chains; no stick clip needed
content.location: This is the bolt line right of Sunshine Boys and left of Cedar Fever.

content.description: Easy route to the right of Cedar Fever. The proction is Climb Tech Wave glue-in bolts. They are low profile, so you may have to look. The low anchors are good for top rope for a 5.6
content.protection: 3 glue-ins to the lower anchors, an additional gluein at 1 O'Clock to the anchors will take you on a 5.10+ or 5.11 run to a high set of anchors.
content.location: To the right of Cedar Fever about 8 feet.

content.description: Cedar Fever is on the right side of the Geritol Wall. This route travels up some moderate low angle stuff to start. Then it enters a vertical section with some good seams and a small shelf. In middle of this route there is a long reach, which can be made easier by using a mantle. After the no hands rest ledge comes the crux. Move up and right off of a 2 finger undercling pocket and a flat edge to a good pocket/edge and then the top.
content.location: This is the bolt line to the right of Rock and Roll High School. The next bolt line to its right is Prism.

content.description: 4 quality routes tucked in the trees.
